member.name: M:ExceptionExtensions.RethrowWithNoStackTraceLoss(System.Exception)
member.summary: Rethrows an exception object without losing the existing stack trace information
member.remarks: For more information on this technique, see http://www.dotnetjunkies.com/WebLog/chris.taylor/archive/2004/03/03/8353.aspx. The remote_stack_trace string is here to support Mono.

member.name: M:ExceptionExtensions.Unwrap(System.Exception)
member.summary: Unwraps an exception to remove any wrappers, like .
member.returns: The unwrapped exception.

member.name: T:Xunit.AppDomainTestFramework
member.summary: Wraps around an implementation of that is run from another app domain. This is typically done to ensure that assemblies aren't locked during discovery and run, so that further builds can take place while activities are still ongoing.

member.name: M:Xunit.AppDomainTestFramework.#ctor(Xunit.Abstractions.ISourceInformationProvider,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The file path of the test framework assembly (i.e., xunit2.dll).
The fully qualified type name of the implementation of in the test framework assembly.
If set to true, runs tests in a shadow copied app domain, which allows tests to be discovered and run without locking assembly files on disk.

member.name: M:Xunit.AppDomainTestFramework.CreateRemoteObject``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an object (from the test framework assembly) in the remote app domain.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to cast to.
member.param: The fully qualified type name to create.
The arguments for the type's constructor.
member.returns: An instance of the created object, cast to .

member.name: T:Xunit.IFrontController
member.summary: Represents a class which acts as a front controller for unit testing frameworks. This allows runners to run tests from multiple unit testing frameworks (in particular, hiding the differences between xUnit.net v1 and v2 tests).

member.name: T:Xunit.Xunit1
member.summary: This class be used to do discovery and execution of xUnit.net v1 tests using a reflection-based implementation of . Runner authors are strongly encouraged to use instead of using this class directly.

member.name: M:Xunit.Xunit1.#ctor(Xunit.Abstractions.ISourceInformationProvider,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: If set to true, runs tests in a shadow copied app domain, which allows tests to be discovered and run without locking assembly files on disk.

member.name: M:Xunit.Xunit1.CreateExecutor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a wrapper to call the Executor call from xUnit.net v1.
member.param: The filename of the assembly under test.
The configuration file to be used for the app domain (optional, may be null).
Whether to enable shadow copy for the app domain.
member.returns: The executor wrapper.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Default implementation of which supports running tests from both xUnit.net v1 and v2.

member.summary: This constructor is for unit testing purposes only.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: If set to true, runs tests in a shadow copied app domain, which allows The source information provider. If null, uses the default (). tests to be discovered and run without locking assembly files on disk.

member.name: T:Xunit.Xunit2Discoverer
member.summary: This class be used to do discovery of xUnit.net v2 tests, via any implementation of , including AST-based runners like CodeRush and Resharper. Runner authors who are not using AST-based discovery are strongly encouraged to use instead.

member.name: M:Xunit.Xunit2Discoverer.#ctor(Xunit.Abstractions.ISourceInformationProvider,Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The location of xunit2.dll is implied based on the location of the test assembly.
member.param: The assembly to use for discovery

member.name: M:Xunit.Xunit2Discoverer.#ctor(Xunit.Abstractions.ISourceInformationProvider,Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor is usually used by AST-based runners which may not have access to a test assembly on disk, but can point to xunit2.dll (by following the project reference in Visual Studio).
member.param: The assembly to use for discovery
The path on disk of xunit2.dll

member.name: P:Xunit.Xunit2Discoverer.Framework
member.summary: Returns the test framework from the remote app domain.

member.name: T:Xunit.Xunit2
member.summary: This class be used to do discovery and execution of xUnit.net v2 tests using a reflection-based implementation of .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: If set to true, runs tests in a shadow copied app domain, which allows tests to be discovered and run without locking assembly files on disk.

member.name: T:Xunit.AssemblyHelper
member.summary: This class provides assistance with assembly resolution for missing assemblies. Runners may need to use to help automatically resolve missing assemblies when running tests.

member.name: M:Xunit.AssemblyHelper.SubscribeResolve
member.summary: Subscribes to the current event, to provide automatic assembly resolution for assemblies in the runner.
member.returns: An object which, when disposed, un-subscribes.

member.name: T:Xunit.RemotingUtility
member.summary: Internal helper class for remoting.

member.name: M:Xunit.RemotingUtility.CleanUpRegisteredChannels
member.summary: Unregisters any remoting channels.
member.remarks: If there are any registered remoting channels, then MarshalByRefObjects don't work. Based on bug #9749, it's clear that MSTest (at least through Visual Studio 2010) registers remoting channels when it runs but doesn't clean them up when it's done. Right now, the only way to reliably surface this issue is through MSBuild (as per the bug repro), so for the moment this work-around code is limited to the MSBuild runner.

member.name: T:Xunit.XunitProject
member.summary: Represents an xUnit.net Test Project file (.xunit file)

member.summary: Saves the xUnit.net Test Project file to disk using the project's filename.

member.summary: Saves the xUnit.net Test Project file to disk using the provided filename. The projects filename is updated to match this new name.

member.summary: Gets or sets the assemblies in the project.

member.name: P:Xunit.XunitProject.Filters
member.summary: Gets the filters applied to this project.

member.name: P:Xunit.XunitProject.IsDirty
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag which indicates if this project has been modified since the last time it was loaded or saved.

member.name: P:Xunit.XunitProject.Output
member.summary: Gets or sets the output filenames. The dictionary key is the type of the file to be output; the dictionary value is the filename to write the output to. Supported output types vary by runner (console output types can be seen by getting help from the console runner; MSBuild runner only supports 'html', 'xml', and 'xmlv1').

member.name: T:Xunit.TestMessageVisitor`1
member.summary: An implementation of that provides several Visit methods that can provide access to specific message types without the burden of casting. It also record when it sees a completion message, and sets the event appropriately.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: This event is trigged when the completion message has been seen.
